unnormalised: ## Lights, Camera, FESTIVAL! Why You Should Hit Up a Film Fest
normalised: ## Lights, Camera, FESTIVAL! Why You Should Hit Up a Film Fest

unnormalised: Hey movie buffs! Tired of the same old Netflix and chill routine? Wanna spice things up and dive headfirst into the world of cinema? Then listen up, because film festivals are where it’s AT.
normalised: Hey movie buffs! Tired of the same old Netflix and chill routine? Wanna spice things up and dive headfirst into the world of cinema? Then listen up, because film festivals are where it’s A T.

unnormalised: Forget paying Rs. 300 for a predictable Bollywood blockbuster (no shade to Dharma Productions, *Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham* is still a classic!), film festivals are your ticket to discovering hidden gems, indie darlings, and documentaries that will actually make you think.
normalised: Forget paying rupee three hundred for a predictable Bollywood blockbuster (no shade to Dharma Productions, *Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham* is still a classic!), film festivals are your ticket to discovering hidden gems, indie darlings, and documentaries that will actually make you think.

unnormalised: Think about it: a weekend dedicated to watching incredible movies, meeting passionate filmmakers, and debating plot twists with fellow cinephiles over chai and samosas. Doesn't that sound infinitely better than scrolling through the endless streaming menus?
normalised: Think about it: a weekend dedicated to watching incredible movies, meeting passionate filmmakers, and debating plot twists with fellow cinephiles over chai and samosas. Doesn't that sound infinitely better than scrolling through the endless streaming menus?

unnormalised: India's got some amazing film festivals. We're talking the International Film Festival of India (IFFI) in Goa – sun, sand, and seriously good cinema! Or how about the Mumbai Film Festival (MAMI)? It’s a total industry hotspot, with screenings all over the city. You might even spot your favorite Bollywood star!
normalised: India's got some amazing film festivals. We're talking the International Film Festival of India (I F F I) in Goa – sun, sand, and seriously good cinema! Or how about the Mumbai Film Festival (M A M I)? It’s a total industry hotspot, with screenings all over the city. You might even spot your favorite Bollywood star!

unnormalised: Film festivals aren't just for serious film critics, though. They're for anyone who loves movies and wants to broaden their horizons. You'll find everything from experimental shorts to hard-hitting social commentaries. You might even stumble upon the next big director before they make it big in Hollywood!
normalised: Film festivals aren't just for serious film critics, though. They're for anyone who loves movies and wants to broaden their horizons. You'll find everything from experimental shorts to hard-hitting social commentaries. You might even stumble upon the next big director before they make it big in Hollywood!

unnormalised: So, next time you're looking for something exciting to do, ditch the mall and check out the film festival scene. It's a fantastic way to support independent filmmakers, discover new cultures, and maybe even expand your own perspectives. Plus, the food stalls are usually pretty amazing! I mean, who can say no to piping hot jalebis after a screening?

unnormalised: Trust me, experiencing cinema in a festival setting is a whole different vibe. It's like a cultural immersion, a mini-vacation, and a crash course in filmmaking all rolled into one.
normalised: Trust me, experiencing cinema in a festival setting is a whole different vibe. It's like a cultural immersion, a mini-vacation, and a crash course in filmmaking all rolled into one.

unnormalised: And hey, you might even find your next favorite film. Maybe it'll win an Oscar, maybe it'll just stay etched in your memory. Either way, it's an experience you won't forget. So, get your tickets, pack your popcorn (or your chakli, we don't judge!), and get ready to be amazed!
